io9:

VB7: If you are working with a team on a project, that’s very discouraged, cause they might not know which “File” (java.io.File or some File type in the Sun API)

item.title: Problem with ImageIO
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

BufferedImage is in java.awt.image.BufferedImage
File is in java.io.File

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with ImageIO
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Yeah, but don’t write the sub images to file if you are planning on using them in a game. Rather keep them together and just parse the tilesets as they are needed.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with ImageIO
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:3, topic:134516”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=185912.msg1682124#msg1682124 date=1187391126]
java.awt.image.BufferedImage
[/quote]

Ah, so that’s where it is. I thought it was bundled with ImageIO…

Thank you!

PS: Now how would I write the subImage to a new file?[/quote]

BufferedImage subimage = mainBufferedImage.getSubimage(x, y, width, height);
ImageIO.write(subimage, "png", new File("./", "boobs.png"));

I believe the format types support all the normal images such as “png”, “jpg”, and “bmp”.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with ImageIO
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Hi guys. I’m trying to read a single image from a tileset, but it’s telling me that the “BufferedImage” class doesn’t exist, even though I’m importing it.

I can’t figure it out, here’s the code:

[code]
import javax.imageio.ImageIO;

public class tileSplit
{
public static void main(String[] args)
{
String tilesetPath = “”;

	tilesetPath = args[0];

	BufferedImage tileSet = ImageIO.read(new File(tilesetPath));
	BufferedImage tile = tileSet.getSubimage(0, 16, 16, 16);

}

}[/code]

and here are the errors I’m getting:

Read full topic
